ygData.subject: Re: Skill gain
ygData.msgSnippet: The method I am using so far is: I started out with 19 points, then made files till it was trivial (like 23 I think), then I switched to scalars and now I have
ygData.messageBody:
The method I am using so far is:

I started out with 19 points, then made files till it was trivial (like 23 I
think), then I switched to scalars and now I have a skill of 29. I was
under the impression that you do scalars till you max in that, then switch
to skewers.

That is what I know on the process. Something I have not heard anyone talk
about ever is your faction standing and how it effects the smithing process.
Being a wood elf currently I thought the best place to go to get ore would
be Steamfont. But all the gnomes there are apprehensive of me which means
bad prices. The only other place I knew to go was N Freeport, so I made the
long journey and low and behold the humans regard me indifferently. I ended
up saving a Silver per ore and 2 copper per water. Now on its own that
does sound like much, but thing of how much ore you have buy. Every 100 ore
you buy you save a platinum.

So that is my addition to the forum for now I guess. Anyone know about what
skill one can make studs reliably and what you need to make them?

Thanx,
Ailenu
Rallos Zek

-----Original Message-----
From: TSNFrodos@... [mailto:TSNFrodos@...]
Sent: Tuesday, April 13, 1999 4:24 AM
To: EQ_Blacksmiths@onelist.com
Subject: [EQ_Blacksmiths] Skill gain


From: TSNFrodos@...

it seems that from skill 25 to skill 40 scalars are a good skill gain item,
from 41 to prob mid 50's lantern casings seem to be providing better results

than skewers according to my source...

also rumors are floating around that a PC smith who refuses to divulge his
secret has discovered how to make Plate Armor of some kind
